text: in this video you'll learn how to set an
alarm to alert you to a critical job
flow event to begin log into the Amazon
web services Management console and
select the cloudwatch tab click the
create alarm button this brings up the
create alarm wizard search on elastic
map ruce or the job flow identifier to
find the job flow metrics reported by
elastic
maper when you launch a job flow elastic
maer automatically pushes metrics data
to
cloudwatch scroll through the elastic
map reduce metrics to the is Idol report
the is Idle metric is a Boolean that is
one if the job flow has been idle for
more than 5 minutes and zero otherwise
you can use it to detect job flows that
are no longer producing results but
which are still incurring charges to
your account you can set an alarm that
will email you if your job flow enters
this state it's an alarm that can save
you money by giving you the opportunity
to shut down idle job
flows select is idle and hit the
continue
button now we need to Define some
details about this alarm the name should
be a short word or phrase that describes
the alarm it's used as part of the
subject line in the alarm email the
description is where you can add
additional information about the alarm
such as what the alarm means and the
actions to take this value is sent in
the body of the alarm email
the next step is to set threshold limits
for the alarm clicking the drop- down
box shows you the conditionals you can
use to define this limit for this alarm
select greater than or equal to type a
value into the threshold since is Idol
is a Boolean enter one the next field
asks how long the value has to be at the
threshold before the alarm fires since
elastic map reduce only updates is Idle
every 5 minutes you need to specify a
value greater than or equal to 5 hit
continue the alarm State we want to
choose is alarm the action we want this
alarm to take is to automatically send
an email when the threshold is reached
cloudwatch uses the simple notification
service to send the email if you've
previously created an email subscription
list for notifications and simple
notification service it will appear in
this drop- down box click continue at
this point the create alarm wizard gives
you a chance to review the alarm you're
about to create if you need to make any
changes you can use the edit links on
the right click create alarm
congratulations you've just created an
alarm that will notify you if your job
flow is idle for 10 minutes or longer
you can click on the alarm in Cloud
watch to view the alarm details if you
want to modify or delete the alarm you
can use the buttons above that's how to
set an email alarm in cloudwatch to
monitor your Amazon elastic map reduce
job flows for more information about Job
flow metrics and monitoring go to the
Amazon elastic map produce to developer
guide available online
